subject: Re: [junit] Database Testing in JUnit
msgSnippet: ... * keywords Dallaway unit test database * dbunit.sourceforge.net can help you set up database fixtures and check the expected results against the actual
messageBody:
sherlocksridhar wrote:
> Dear All,
>
> I have recently started using TDD as my development methodology.
> JUnit has been my starting point, especially since it has good
> integration with Eclipse.
>
> As with all newbies, I have a question regarding unit Testing
> Database applications. I have tried searching in Google as well as
> previous messages in this group, but I haven't really seen something
> that I can understand at my stage [also, my dearching skills may not
> be that good!]
>
> If you can simply point me so some good posts in this group or some
> links on Google, I will take it from there.

* keywords "Dallaway unit test database"
* dbunit.sourceforge.net can help you set up database fixtures and
check the expected results against the actual results.
* Chapter 10 of _JUnit Recipes_, of course.

> Some background: We use JDBC code within our Java applications and
> we have separated as much database code as possible. There still
> remain some classes which need to have JDBC code for performance
> reasons. We connect to a database on a separate server and do not
> intend to use an in-memory database.

Why not use an in-memory database for testing?
--
